facts.fact: I have GitLab access to gitlab.lab.nkontur.com with user 'moltbot'
Homelab repo is at root/homelab (project ID: 4)
GitLab token has both git push and API access (can create MRs)
Push to repo triggers GitLab CI → Ansible deploys to router
Created MR #2: CI dry-run validation for MRs (merged)
Created MR #3: CI caching for faster builds
Router (router.lab.nkontur.com) IS the Docker host — everything runs on one machine. satellite-2 is a separate device.
Homelab has 44 containers, 9 dependency edges, 3 clusters (IoT/Home, Observability, Security). Deepest chain: 3 levels.
JIT service listens on port 8080 from moltbot container. Auth header: X-JIT-API-Key with key from Vault at agents/jit-api-key.
SSH certs from JIT have principal 'claude', only works on hosts with Vault CA trusted.
Vault runs at 10.3.32.6:8200. Uses auto-unseal. cap_drop ALL requires IPC_LOCK, CHOWN, DAC_OVERRIDE, FOWNER, SETUID, SETGID.
Docker cap_drop persists until container recreation — reverting compose file doesn't restore capabilities on running containers.
GitLab PAT has full api scope + cross-project access including project 8 (images). Critical security finding — should be replaced with scoped project token.
Gmail migrating from app password to Google OAuth2. Two JIT resources: gmail-read (T2, gmail.readonly) and gmail-send (T2, gmail.send). MR !220.
Loki accessible via https://loki.lab.nkontur.com (nginx proxy). MR !214 binds to localhost only — container-to-container still works via Docker network.
Scrub-transcripts cron runs every 10min on host. Script at docker/moltbot/scripts/scrub-transcripts.sh. Had wrong volume mount (moltbot-gateway vs moltbot/data). Fixed in MR !224.
